p: Methylated xanthines (methylxanthines) are heterocyclic organic compounds that are methylated derivatives of xanthine, therefore comprising coupled rings of pyrimidinedione and imidazole. They are present in almost 100 species of 13 orders from the plant kingdom, including tea ( Camellia sinensis L.), coffee ( Coffea sp.), and cocoa ( Theobroma cacao L.), being normally included in the daily human diet in many drinks and foods extremely common, such as coffee, tea, cocoa, yerba mate, and cola. Caffeine (60), theophylline (61), and theobromine (62) ( Figure 9) are the main methylxanthines available from natural sources [ 125, 126].
